channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gen Zers may not have a house or kids, but data shows they’re spoiling their pets more than any other generation instead
item.description: While Gen Z respondents spent the most on their pets per month this year, they were the most likely to have insurance and least likely to get into pet...

item.title: Azerbaijan Airlines Passenger Plane Crashes in Kazakhstan
item.description: Russia’s state aviation authority said the Azerbaijan Airlines plane had been trying to make an emergency landing. The Kazakh authorities said that at...

item.title: Syria’s New Leaders Try to Unite Rebel Factions Under Defense Ministry
item.description: The fighters who ousted Bashar al-Assad are aiming to transform their revolutionary movement and assert control over the country.

item.title: A Billionaire Gave $1,000 to UMass Dartmouth Graduates. Some Missed Out.
item.description: A billionaire gave $1,000 to University of Massachusetts Dartmouth graduates in May. You had to be there.

item.title: ‘A Complete Unknown’ Review: Timothée Chalamet Goes Electric
item.description: The actor stars as a young Bob Dylan, who woos folk followers only to betray them later at the 1965 Newport Folk Festival.

item.title: Pope Francis Calls for Peace in Ukraine and Gaza on Christmas
item.description: Pope Francis’ Christmas message was a plea for reconciliation, peace and care for others.

item.title: If Syrian Chemical Weapons Were Found, the U.S. Army Could Safely Destroy Them
item.description: A civilian team at a base in Maryland disposed of Syrian toxins a decade ago after hundreds of people were killed in a nerve agent attack.

item.title: How to watch the Christmas Day games of the 2024-2025 NFL season live online for free—and without cable
item.description: A new streaming service takes the field.

item.title: Researchers have followed over 700 people since 1938 to find the keys to happiness. Here’s what they discovered
item.description: The secret to happiness is more in our control than we think.

item.title: Desi Bouterse, Fugitive Former Dictator of Suriname, Dies at 79
item.description: He took power in a military coup in 1980 and later served as the country’s president. He was also convicted of ordering the murder of 15 political opp...

item.title: ‘A Charlie Brown Christmas’ almost never aired because CBS executives didn’t like it
item.description: Back in the 1960s, commercial realities almost derailed Schulz’s special.

item.title: ‘Babygirl’ Review: Nicole Kidman Takes Control
item.description: Nicole Kidman bares body and some soul in a story about a married woman who enters a dominant-submissive affair with a younger man.

item.title: Boomer-centric wine industry at a crossroads as Gen Z turns away from alcohol
